list_definition.definition: to leave a (permanent) dirty mark or coloured/colored patch on eg a fabric

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The coffee I spilt has stained my trousers.

list_definition.mean_english: trở nên đổi màu, trở nên vấy bẩn
list_definition.definition: to become marked in this way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The wooden chairs had been stained brown.

list_definition.mean_english: sự biến màu, chất nhuộm, vết bẩn
list_definition.definition: a dirty mark on a fabric etc that is difficult or impossible to remove

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His overall was covered with paint-stains
There is not the slightest stain upon her reputation.

list_ex_of_english: The staining intensity was categorically coded as 0 (absent), 1 (weak), 2 (moderate), or 3 (strong).
The level of staining throughout the syncytium was markedly increased.
The product was analyzed by agarose (2%) gel electrophoresis and stained with ethidium bromide.
We have previously demonstrated that staining for intracellular cytokines correlated with cytokine secretion.
In each assay, five categories of staining were observed as defined previously.
Alpha 2 adrergic receptors in cilairy and retina marker which stains the plasma membrane of the soma.

The sections were stained with antibodies for those two antigens.
